TopicTitle: Anyway else think the Despicable Me Minions must be close relatives to Kerbals?

Articles.Content:
They seem to have he same attitude on life (especially love of explosions), they have similar dimensions, both only seem to come in male, and both seem to have limitless quantities!

Your opinions?

Kerbals don't go "BA-NA-NA" though...

"heheh... bottom"
omg you maybe onto something..
Jeb's getting worried...
Yes! I was thinking the exact same thing a few days ago. I didn't really think about why, though.

This was exactly my thougts as well. Maybe they are both coming from the same planet, and when they had to abandon it and fled out in space, they landed on two different planets and since, evolution has made them look a bit different
They must be related, They both love explosions and look similar.
Maybe the minions are kerbals who fell into a lake of bleach??

I thought kerbals were more like Rabbids.

That second one, definitely. Also, I reckon that the kerbals should scream like the rabbids when things go awry.
They need their own show, that's for sure.
I love the clip of one of the minions doing a superman when he hits a flying duck... goes QuackQuack at it and then gets attacked lol. EVERY time I see that I can't stop laughing.

They need their own show, that's for sure.

no, what we need is the animation assets for the kerbals released, can you imagine what the SFM(source filmmaker) community would make with it?

Jeb's getting worried...

.... That's Bob.

no, what we need is the animation assets for the kerbals released, can you imagine what the SFM(source filmmaker) community would make with it?

Already asked... no plans for release and the short kerbal movies are made in something called 'maya'?
I usually explain Kerbal Space Program to new comers by telling them "Imagine the minions from Despicable Me are green and have a space program"

"Imagine the minions from Despicable Me are green and have a space program"

This is SO going to be my signature.....
Keep in mind how the Minions gave Gru as much money as was required to make that Moon-Shrinking rocket. That may be how the Space Program gets so much money. Kerbals paying every. last. cent.

Keep in mind how the Minions gave Gru as much money as was required to make that Moon-Shrinking rocket. That may be how the Space Program gets so much money. Kerbals paying every. last. cent.

The minions did send someone to the Moon with a home made rocket. (Almost wrote Mun then.) With the assistance of a human. Sounds kerbalish to me.
Having seen how they go about changing a light bulb, I think there's some merit to this.

.... That's Bob.

Nope... was modified from this image...
i've thought about this same thing, i can't get enough of those minions . perhaps they were outcast by the kerbals for being too yellow, then gru found them and gave them a home

yes, it was the first thing that popped up in my mind when i saw the movie..

They are different, and still a bit simulair, and have the same way of approaching science

Prolly distant related

When I described the game to my friends (before they started playing themselves) I used the minions as an example of a rough kerbal, explaining that they weren't the same but to give them an idea of what kerbals were.

Well, since it seems most likely that kerbals are in a different universe. The despicable me minions could be the alternate universe kerbals, just that they're in our universe, and that they've learned to understand english.

When I started playing the KSP demo, one of the first things I said to my wife was, "This game would be 100 times funnier if they used the minions from Despicable Me." Maybe the KSP developers can ask about licensing them.
